On 10/27/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
>
> I thi=
nk, when doing TDD the main benefit is not to find bugs it is to
> guide
> =
your design.


Really?

The main reason why I write tests is to make sure t=
hat no regressions will
happen.  From the point where I submit my tests, I =
know that no matter what
code gets checked in after me, the functionality o=
f the system will not
decrease.

Tests also help a great deal make my code =
more robust.

But drive my design with tests? That's dangerous and can pote=
ntially lead to
micro-design, i.e. design without seeing the big picture ("=
I'll use this
signature because the test looks cleaner then").

-- 
C=E9dri=
c
